entry.title: Russia SMS Carrier Maintenance - MTS
entry.summary: THIS IS A SCHEDULED EVENT Jan 17, 20:30 - 22:00 PST Jan 17, 09:32 PST Scheduled - The MTS network in Russia is conducting an emergency maintenance from 17 January 2023 at 20:30 PST until 17 January 2023 at 22:00 PST. During the maintenance window, there could be intermittent delays delivering SMS to and from MTS Russia handsets.

We will provide updates as necessary. Jan 16, 04:49 PST Scheduled - The Beeline network in Russia is conducting an emergency maintenance from 17 January 2023 at 12:00 PST until 17 January 2023 at 16:00 PST. During the maintenance window, there could be intermittent delays delivering SMS to and from Beeline Russia handsets.

entry.title: Delays in Bulk Export Tool via Twilio Rest API
entry.summary: Jan 17, 15:42 PST Update - We are currently investigating elevated latency and timeout errors for Twilio Rest API, impacting the following Twilio services: Bulk exports. Customers may experience inaccurate estimated completion times. Our engineering team is actively working on the issue and we will provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available. Jan 17, 15:30 PST Investigating - Our monitoring systems have detected a potential issue affecting bulk exports via API Service. Our engineering team has been alerted and is actively investigating. We will update as soon as we have more information.

entry.title: Incident: Users may experience issues accessing or loading Slack, have trouble creating posts, and using Workflow Builder.
entry.summary:
Issue summary:
From January 16th, 2023 04:59 to 08:38 AM PST, some users experienced issues creating Posts, using workflows, and trouble accessing Slack.
We traced this back to an issue with our internal DNS configuration. Once this was identified and resolved, functionality was restored to all impacted users.

entry.title: Incident: Some Android users may be experiencing issues when trying to access a workspace
entry.summary:
Issue summary:
From January 10th 04:11 AM PST to January 16th 07:54 PM PST, some of our fellow Slack colleagues were unable to access their workspaces on Android. We're happy to share that this issue was specifically related to our internal testing app, having no impact on the Slack production app nor our Customers.
This issue has been resolved and will have no impact on our future Android app releases.

entry.title: TS-2023-001
entry.summary: Description: An issue in the Tailscale coordination server allowed a malicious individual to share nodes from other tailnets to themselves, if they knew the node ID of the target. What happened? A bug in Tailscale’s node sharing logic allowed the creation of sharing invitations by unauthorized users. A malicious individual who knew a target node’s database ID could generate and accept a sharing invite for that node without being an admin of the target node’s tailnet. This was possible for any node in any tailnet, as long as the individual knew the target’s node ID. The node ID is an integer used in the admin panel’s database, and is not related to the node “StableID” that is visible to Tailscale clients. A node’s ID is only visible in the API or admin console, by admins of either the node’s tailnet or a tailnet to which that node has already been shared. IDs are not sequential or otherwise easily guessable. The bug was introduced on 2022-09-14, reported to us on 2023-01-11, and remediated on 2023-01-12. Who is affected? All tailnets with nodes are affected. What is the impact? This vulnerability was not triggered or exploited. Analysis of tailnet logs shows that no unauthorized shares were created or accepted while the vulnerability was present, except as part of the proof of concept from the individual who reported the vulnerability. Admins of a tailnet can review nodes that are shared out of their tailnet in the admin console. Sharing invites are logged as events in configuration audit logs. Admins can also review invites created and accepted in their configuration audit logs in the admin console. What do I need to do? No action is required. Tailscale has deployed a fix to the coordination server as of 2023-01-12, and verified that the vulnerability was not exploited. Credits We would like to thank Benjamin Roberts (tsujamin) for reporting this issue.

entry.title: Servers down
entry.summary: Jan 16, 09:00 PST Resolved - Notion was down between 8:56 - 9:12 AM PT. Service is now recovered.

entry.title: Incident with Actions
entry.summary: Jan 16, 16:43 UTC Resolved - This incident has been resolved. Jan 16, 16:31 UTC Update - We found an issue that caused high database replication lag, leading to issues visible in multiple services. We have resolved this issue and are expecting services to become healthy once queues drain. Jan 16, 15:51 UTC Investigating - We are investigating reports of degraded performance for Actions.

entry.title: Incident: Some customers may be unable to complete SSO configuration
entry.summary:
From January 6th at 8:42 AM PST to January 15th at 10:00 PM PST, some users were running into issues when completing their SSO configuration. In the SSO settings the "Test Configuration" button led to an error message page.
We identified a recent code change as the cause of the issue and a fix was launched to correct it.

entry.title: 500 Errors Across Multiple Endpoints
entry.summary: Jan 9, 15:10 PST Resolved - From 14:00-15:00 Pacific Time (PT), we saw increased 500 errors for multiple API endpoints, including reservations, listings and threads. The issue is now identified and resolved, please retry any failed requests during this time. Apologies for the inconvenience caused due to this incident and thank you for your patience and understanding.

entry.title: Delay in email delivery due to third-party outage
entry.summary: Jan 5, 15:49 UTC Resolved - This incident has been resolved. Jan 5, 02:25 UTC Monitoring - A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results. Jan 5, 01:45 UTC Update - We are continuing to monitor our third-party service provider for updates. Service has not been restored by the third-party email provider. Once service is restored, the majority of emails that were not sent during the outage will be resent. Jan 5, 01:14 UTC Update - We are continuing to monitor our third-party service provider for updates. Service has not been restored by the third-party email provider. Once service is restored, the majority of emails that were not sent during the outage will be resent. Jan 5, 00:38 UTC Update - Service has not been restored by the third-party email provider. We are working to confirm service has been restored. Jan 4, 23:31 UTC Investigating - Our third-party email delivery provider has been experiencing an outage since Jan 4th, 2:10 PM PST, causing a delay in notification delivery for all Rippling emails (including password resets). We are investigating this issue with the third-party provider.

entry.title: Missing Workspace section in sidebar
entry.summary: Dec 21, 10:31 PST Resolved - We have implemented the fix and confirmed the issue is resolved. Workspace section and pages have been restored to the sidebar for affected users. Dec 21, 10:06 PST Identified - Since ~3:30pm Pacific time yesterday, some users on Free and Plus plans have been unable to see pages in the Workspace section of the sidebar. We have identified the root cause and a fix is in progress.

entry.title: Incident: Messages on iOS are automatically marked as read
entry.summary:
Issue summary:
From Monday December 12, 2022 at 10:27 AM PST to Monday December 19, 2022 at 1:30 PM PST, we began investigating reports of messages being marked as read when backgrounding the iOS app while in a conversation. As a result, the sidebar would not show unread messages next to the DM/Channel/Threads view.
We have now made a change on our end that resolved the issue and released a fix on iOS app version 22.12.21. Users on the iOS app should now be able to receive messages without them being marked as read automatically.
